definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: After the accident, the wheel of the car had been twisted out of shape.
sentences.chinese: 出事故之后，车轮子已扭曲变形了。

sentences.english: My wheel twisted off in the middle of the car race.
sentences.chinese: 我的车轮子在汽车比赛中途脱掉了。

sentences.english: I got one of those shopping carts with a weird wheel.
sentences.chinese: 我的那个购物车轮子太古怪。

sentences.english: You stay here and I will go to check the wheels.
sentences.chinese: 你呆在这里，我去检查一下车轮子。

sentences.english: People are always coming in here borrowing my hammer, you know, to fix a cart wheel or something.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，总是有人来借我的锤子修理大车轮子什么的。

sentences.english: Has the wheel been properly trued up?

definition: car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
open-topped container (mounted on a truck or cart) for carrying loads/dump box (of a dump truck)/bucket (of a front loader)/wheelbarrow
caterpillar track (propulsion system used on bulldozers etc)/(literary) shoes and belt
